  • django.core.serializers
  • View page source

django.core.serializersÔÉÅ

Interfaces for serializing Django objects.

Usage:

from django.core import serializers
json = serializers.serialize("json", some_queryset)
objects = list(serializers.deserialize("json", json))

To add your own serializers, use the SERIALIZATION_MODULES setting:

SERIALIZATION_MODULES = {
    "csv": "path.to.csv.serializer",
    "txt": "path.to.txt.serializer",
}

SubmodulesÔÉÅ

  • django.core.serializers.base
  • django.core.serializers.json
  • django.core.serializers.jsonl
  • django.core.serializers.python
  • django.core.serializers.pyyaml
  • django.core.serializers.xml_serializer

Package ContentsÔÉÅ

django.core.serializers.BUILTIN_SERIALIZERS[source]ÔÉÅ
class django.core.serializers.BadSerializer(exception)[source]ÔÉÅ

Stub serializer to hold exception raised during registration

This allows the serializer registration to cache serializers and if there is an error raised in the process of creating a serializer it will be raised and passed along to the caller when the serializer is used.

internal_use_only = False[source]ÔÉÅ
exception[source]ÔÉÅ
django.core.serializers.register_serializer(format, serializer_module, serializers=None)[source]ÔÉÅ

Register a new serializer.

serializer_module should be the fully qualified module name for the serializer.

If serializers is provided, the registration will be added to the provided dictionary.

If serializers is not provided, the registration will be made directly into the global register of serializers. Adding serializers directly is not a thread-safe operation.

django.core.serializers.unregister_serializer(format)[source]ÔÉÅ

Unregister a given serializer. This is not a thread-safe operation.

django.core.serializers.serialize(format, queryset, **options)[source]ÔÉÅ

Serialize a queryset (or any iterator that returns database objects) using a certain serializer.

django.core.serializers.deserialize(format, stream_or_string, **options)[source]ÔÉÅ

Deserialize a stream or a string. Return an iterator that yields (obj, m2m_relation_dict), where obj is an instantiated ‚Äì but unsaved ‚Äì object, and m2m_relation_dict is a dictionary of {m2m_field_name : list_of_related_objects}.

django.core.serializers.sort_dependencies(app_list, allow_cycles=False)[source]ÔÉÅ

Sort a list of (app_config, models) pairs into a single list of models.

The single list of models is sorted so that any model with a natural key is serialized before a normal model, and any model with a natural key dependency has it‚Äôs dependencies serialized first.

If allow_cycles is True, return the best-effort ordering that will respect most of dependencies but ignore some of them to break the cycles.
